list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Beta 3.4
Updated the MySQL links to use the online database link and also moved resources into the static folder to load the background image for the catalogue page as well as the student template file

recent.name: C:\Users\Joel\OneDrive - International School of Beijing\Documents\Development\Java\Spring Projects\library_\lib

task.summary: Default task
Fixed an error with misc.xml and tested the extractData method

Added a Test Data adder class that adds the list of titles from a local Microsoft Excel file onto the database
Changes to the HTML files were made in an attempt to sort out the sorting error where the website would display all 25000+ books and lag out the website
Reduced the lag due to loading in 25000 books by having the table show after the values had been retrieved from the mysql database
Updated HTML and BookController to split author into last and first name categories
Updated HTML to correct for change of the Book class
Updated HTML to correct for change of the Book class
Functioning version of imorted data
Working user login along with added a user creation form
Implemented the roles in spring security as well as successfully hid the "New User" Button on the catalogue page as well as restricted access to the /user page to only root users
Added a button to the catalogue page, a new corresponding method, and corresponding HTML file that finds a list of all the books based on their name
Finished adding in data to the mysql server and made some small adjustments to the entity classes as well as the book list and catalogue HTML pages to match those changes

Working find by name system, in the process of trying to implement a checkout page successfully. The return function is working, and the checkout and return buttons alternate based on the checkout status. Additionally, remembered to hide the list books if the quantity of books is zero.
Facade of a checkout page, will update the fact that a book is checked out but the id of the student who checked it out is incorrect.

Beta 1.0
Checkout isn't functioning completely but all other functions are working

Beta 1.1
Added a barcode generator, both as a webpage where the user can put their own text in and download a corresponding bar code and a button under the section of each update book page where the barcode that is downloaded corresponds directly to that specific book based on the title and copy number
Added documentation and comments for all the methods in the book controller class

Beta 1.2
Functioning checkout system.
Had to make a new checkout entity that had a Student, List of students, and a book entity as a part of it so that it could be passed as one object to the form in the HTML code

Fixed an issue when saving a new book to catalogue that was caused because of how I had previously made copy numbers, instead of finding the current copy number by using the index of a string I instead split the copy number by a regex "-" and then used the second item in the array

Beta 1.3
Updated the update book form so you can no longer change the current owner of the book, instead it only shows the current owner if there is one
added a toggle to the update book form that lets the user mark the book as discarded, this will highlight the row of the discarded book in red
Updated the corresponding controller methods so the changes are functioning.

Beta 1.3
Updated the update book form so you can no longer change the current owner of the book, instead it only shows the current owner if there is one
added a toggle to the update book form that lets the user mark the book as discarded, this will highlight the row of the discarded book in red
Updated the corresponding controller methods so the changes are functioning.

Beta 1.3
Updated the update book form so you can no longer change the current owner of the book, instead it only shows the current owner if there is one
added a toggle to the update book form that lets the user mark the book as discarded, this will highlight the row of the discarded book in red
Updated the corresponding controller methods so the changes are functioning.
Added an admin options page, currently populated with only the new user button. Options to add new genres and upload a new student list are coming soon.
Updated the admin page so the user can now add new genres, updated the genre select option when adding a new catalogue so that the dropdown list is pulled from the mysql database

Added a background to the heading of the catalogue page, noticed an issue where the link of the previous file hosting website wasn't;t static so that download link for the student upload template would not work after a little, so I decided to host the files on Google Drive
Fixed displaying the names of the owners and the way that the users are saved to the database, instead of saving the student ID's they are now saved as just the names in the actual book table.
Fixed the adding a deletion of single book items so that the quantities of the corresponding catalogue object were change accordingly
Fixed an issue where updating any information in the catalogue object did not update the corresponding book objects

Beta 2
All functions of the program should be working as intended

Beta 2.1
Noticed an issue with the deletion of users, fixed by removing the Bootstrap Modal

Beta 2.2
Added a delete genre button to the admin page

Fixed an issue with the creation of new catalogue objects to set the new ID's for the books
Because the last catalogue's id will not be equal to the length of the catalogue repository length I had the catalogue be saved so that the mysql database would update the id of a new catalogue. Then retrieved the ID from the last item of the catalogue repressory which would be the newly created catalogue object

Fixed an issue with the creation of new catalogue objects to set the new ID's for the books
Because the last catalogue's id will not be equal to the length of the catalogue repository length I had the catalogue be saved so that the mysql database would update the id of a new catalogue. Then retrieved the ID from the last item of the catalogue repressory which would be the newly created catalogue object
Added a new student and delete student options to the Admin Options page
Added a button to download a list of books that have been checked out

Did some slight styling and added a

to the catalogue html file that allows the user to see who is currently logged in

Fixed a bug where the 'delete modal' would be created only once and the book ID it would have would be for the first instance in the table so that every modal that was opened was just the same modal so that any time that an object would be deleted it would delete the first object in the table. I didn't notice this on the catalogue page because I would be testing on a new one and when searching for that catalogue object it owuld be the only one in the table so that modal ID would match. But this became apparent when deleting individual books that had more than one book displayed in the table
This issue was solved by making dynamically updating table names so that there would be a different instance of the modal with the modal id corresponding to the individual bookId/CatalogueId
Fixed the same issue with the User List delete modal

Added a personal user edit link to the user welcome message and noticed an error where the website only updated the list of users once at the start of the website so that any changes made to the database were not actually updated on the website side. This meant that if a user updated their password or username, it will update on the database but if they go to log in with the new username and password it will not work.
To solve this issue I added a Custom user details service class that dynamically updates the list of users that the website has based on the information in the database.
Fixed an alignment issue with the user options and welcome message

Beta 3.0
Added a favicon and corresponding controller method as well as update to the LibraryApplication.java

Beta 3.1
Fixed an issue where if the password was left blank when updating user info, the method would not detect the fact that it was null because it technically had a string value so, I had to use .equals("") instead to verify if the password field was left blank.

Beta 3.2
Added documentation for all methods in the controller classes

Beta 3.3
Updated Database URLs to match digital ocean ones

Beta 3.4
Updated the MySQL links to use the online database link and also moved resources into the static folder to load the background image for the catalogue page as well as the student template file

Beta 3.4
Updated the MySQL links to use the online database link and also moved resources into the static folder to load the background image for the catalogue page as well as the student template file

MESSAGE.value:
Beta 1.3
Updated the update book form so you can no longer change the current owner of the book, instead it only shows the current owner if there is one
added a toggle to the update book form that lets the user mark the book as discarded, this will highlight the row of the discarded book in red
Updated the corresponding controller methods so the changes are functioning.
Added an admin options page, currently populated with only the new user button. Options to add new genres and upload a new student list are coming soon.
Updated the admin page so the user can now add new genres, updated the genre select option when adding a new catalogue so that the dropdown list is pulled from the mysql database

Added a background to the heading of the catalogue page, noticed an issue where the link of the previous file hosting website wasn't;t static so that download link for the student upload template would not work after a little, so I decided to host the files on Google Drive
Fixed displaying the names of the owners and the way that the users are saved to the database, instead of saving the student ID's they are now saved as just the names in the actual book table.
Fixed the adding a deletion of single book items so that the quantities of the corresponding catalogue object were change accordingly
Fixed an issue where updating any information in the catalogue object did not update the corresponding book objects

Beta 2
All functions of the program should be working as intended

Beta 2.1
Noticed an issue with the deletion of users, fixed by removing the Bootstrap Modal

Beta 2.2
Added a delete genre button to the admin page

Fixed an issue with the creation of new catalogue objects to set the new ID's for the books
Because the last catalogue's id will not be equal to the length of the catalogue repository length I had the catalogue be saved so that the mysql database would update the id of a new catalogue. Then retrieved the ID from the last item of the catalogue repressory which would be the newly created catalogue object
Changed it so the generated barcode only shows the first 1/2 words of the title of the book accompanied by the id of the book
Added a new student and delete student options to the Admin Optiosn page
Added a new student and delete student options to the Admin Options page
Added a button to download a list of books that have been checked out

Did some slight styling and added a

to the catalogue html file that allows the user to see who is currently logged in

Fixed a bug where the 'delete modal' would be created only once and the book ID it would have would be for the first instance in the table so that every modal that was opened was just the same modal so that any time that an object would be deleted it would delete the first object in the table. I didn't notice this on the catalogue page because I would be testing on a new one and when searching for that catalogue object it owuld be the only one in the table so that modal ID would match. But this became apparent when deleting individual books that had more than one book displayed in the table
This issue was solved by making dynamically updating table names so that there would be a different instance of the modal with the modal id corresponding to the individual bookId/CatalogueId
Fixed the same issue with the User List delete modal

Added a personal user edit link to the user welcome message and noticed an error where the website only updated the list of users once at the start of the website so that any changes made to the database were not actually updated on the website side. This meant that if a user updated their password or username, it will update on the database but if they go to log in with the new username and password it will not work.
To solve this issue I added a Custom user details service class that dynamically updates the list of users that the website has based on the information in the database.
Fixed an alignment issue with the user options and welcome message

Beta 3.0
Added a favicon and corresponding controller method as well as update to the LibraryApplication.java

Beta 3.1
Fixed an issue where if the password was left blank when updating user info, the method would not detect the fact that it was null because it technically had a string value so, I had to use .equals("") instead to verify if the password field was left blank.

Beta 3.2
Added documentation for all methods in the controller classes

Beta 3.3
Updated Database URLs to match digital ocean ones

Beta 3.4
Updated the MySQL links to use the online database link and also moved resources into the static folder to load the background image for the catalogue page as well as the student template file
